10: So far the informational part. Next the mounting.
11: The command is `mount [-t fstype] something somewhere'.
12: Details found in /etc/fstab may be omitted.
14: mount device             : mount device at the known place
15: mount directory          : mount known device here
16: mount -t type dev dir    : ordinary mount command
17: Note that one does not really mount a device, one mounts
18: a filesystem (of the given type) found on the device.
19: One can also mount an already visible directory tree elsewhere:
23: One can change the type of mount containing the directory dir:
28: One can change the type of all the mounts in a mount subtree
34: A device can be given by name, say /dev/hda1 or /dev/cdrom,
35: or by label, using  -L label  or by uuid, using  -U uuid .
37: For many more details, say  man 8 mount .
